meanings.definition: Willful ignorance or consent to wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: The connivance of the boss allowed the theft to happen unnoticed.
meanings.sent2: The connivance of the students in cheating on the test was evident.
meanings.sent3: The connivance of the cat pretending not to see the mouse was amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her connivance with the bullies made her unpopular among her classmates.
meanings.sent5: The connivance of the clouds hiding the sun made the day gloomy.

meanings.sent1: The connivance between the two companies led to a monopoly in the market.
meanings.sent2: Their connivance to overthrow the government was discovered by the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The connivance of the squirrels to steal nuts from the birds was quite clever.
meanings.sent4: The connivance of the shadows in the alley made it a perfect spot for secret meetings.
meanings.sent5: The connivance of the wind and rain created a stormy night.
